sg.edu.nus.iss.vmcs.customer

Class CoinReceiver

  • java.lang.Object
    • sg.edu.nus.iss.vmcs.customer.CoinReceiver

  • public class CoinReceiver
extends java.lang.Object
    This control object manages the input and storage of Coins.
    Version:
    1.0 2008-10-01
    Author:
    Team SE16T5E

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoinReceiver(TransactionController txCtrl)
      This constructor creates an instance of the object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void continueReceive()
      This method will activate the Coin Input Box so that further coins can be received.
      int getTotalInserted()
      This method returns the total money inserted.
      void receiveCoin(double weight)
      When a coin is received the following will occur: The Coin Input Box will be instructed to become deactivated. The weight of the Coin will be send to the object Coin for it to determine the denomination and value. The Total Money Inserted Display will be updated. If an invalid coin is entered, the Invalid Coin Display will be instructed to display INVALID COIN. The Transaction Controller will be informed to process the current transaction based on the money received.
      void refundCash()
      This method handles the refunding of Coins entered so far to the Customer.
      void resetReceived()
      This method reset the coin received input.
      void setActive(boolean active)
      This method activates or deactivates the Coin Input Box.
      void setTotalInserted(int totalInserted)
      This method sets the total money inserted.
      void startReceiver()
      Commence receiving a series of Coins. To do this the Coin Receiver instructs the Coin Input Box to become activated. It also updates the Total Money Inserted Display on the Customer Panel.
      void stopReceive()
      This method will deactivate the Coin Input Box in order to stop receiving coins.
      boolean storeCash()
      Instruct the Cash Store to update its totals and then re-set the Total Money Inserted Display to zero.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoinReceiver

        public CoinReceiver(TransactionController txCtrl)
        This constructor creates an instance of the object.
        Parameters:
        txCtrl - the transaction controller.

    • Method Detail

      • startReceiver

        public void startReceiver()
        Commence receiving a series of Coins. To do this the Coin Receiver instructs the Coin Input Box to become activated. It also updates the Total Money Inserted Display on the Customer Panel.

      • receiveCoin

        public void receiveCoin(double weight)
        When a coin is received the following will occur:
        1. The Coin Input Box will be instructed to become deactivated.
        2. The weight of the Coin will be send to the object Coin for it to determine the denomination and value.
        3. The Total Money Inserted Display will be updated.
        4. If an invalid coin is entered, the Invalid Coin Display will be instructed to display INVALID COIN.
        5. The Transaction Controller will be informed to process the current transaction based on the money received.
        Parameters:
        weight - the weight of the coin received.

      • continueReceive

        public void continueReceive()
        This method will activate the Coin Input Box so that further coins can be received.

      • storeCash

        public boolean storeCash()
        Instruct the Cash Store to update its totals and then re-set the Total Money Inserted Display to zero.
        Returns:
        return TRUE if cash has been stored, else return FALSE.

      • stopReceive

        public void stopReceive()
        This method will deactivate the Coin Input Box in order to stop receiving coins.

      • refundCash

        public void refundCash()
        This method handles the refunding of Coins entered so far to the Customer.

      • resetReceived

        public void resetReceived()
        This method reset the coin received input.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        This method activates or deactivates the Coin Input Box.
        Parameters:
        active - TRUE to activate, FALSE to deactivate the Coin Input Box.

      • setTotalInserted

        public void setTotalInserted(int totalInserted)
        This method sets the total money inserted.
        Parameters:
        totalInserted - the total money inserted.

      • getTotalInserted

        public int getTotalInserted()
        This method returns the total money inserted.
        Returns:
        the total money inserted.
